author: Yuka Hayashi
title: Democrats Question CFPB Officials’ Salaries as They Grill Mulvaney
text:
WASHINGTON—Democratic lawmakers scrutinized the pay of political appointees at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Thursday, as they grilled its acting chief for a second day about the bureau’s direction under the Trump administration.
The heated exchanges at the Senate Banking Committee centered on the pay for the eight officials brought in by Mick Mulvaney after he was appointed the CFPB’s acting director in November, including four top officials whose combined pay exceeds $1 million a year.
